alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Franklin; Montgomery; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 7:11PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A gusty shower will impact portions of Roanoke, northeastern Floyd, northwestern Franklin and east central Montgomery Counties, the City of Salem and the City of Roanoke through 745 PM EDT... At 709 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a gusty shower near Shawsville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roanoke... Salem... Vinton... Copper Hill... Shawsville... Bent Mountain... and Hollins. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
